14:30 <mflorea> vmassol: there's no "Office" category for RN changes. Do I have to create it? Can I simply use "Office" in the text input?  
15:08 <vmassol> yes you can  
15:08 <vmassol> (mflorea)  
15:08 <vmassol> (and should)

21:54 <ansuz> has joined #xwiki  
21:54 <ansuz> hello friends  
21:54 <ansuz> whaaaats happening  
21:54 <ansuz> hi lgierth  
21:55 <Kubuxu> I suspect that his bot is written in Java  
21:57 <hakin> has quit  
21:57 <ansuz> of course  
21:57 <ansuz> everything good is written in Java  
21:57 <lgierth> hey ansuz  
21:57 <lgierth> i'm sitting in a laundromat shop on king st.  
21:57 <lgierth> and you?  
21:57 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
21:58 <cjd> Hello Friends  
21:58 <ansuz> xwiki office  
21:58 <ansuz> still  
21:58 <ansuz> hacking on fc00  
21:58 <ansuz> king and what?  
21:58 <lgierth> king and dufferin  
21:59 <lgierth> thought i'd go west  
21:59 <ansuz> nice  
21:59 <ansuz> across from shoeless joe's  
22:00 <benedict2> has joined #xwiki  
22:00 <ansuz> I used to live 4 minutes from there  
22:00 <benedict2> hii  
22:01 <ansuz> and I have a server with the hostname 'dufferin'  
22:01 <ansuz> hi benedict2  
22:01 <benedict2> my handles are all messed up  
22:01 <ansuz> bicycle?  
22:01 <benedict2> heh those are fine  
22:02 <ansuz> oh, irc?  
22:02 <ansuz> irc is har  
22:02 <ansuz> d  
22:02 <benedict2> yea they are all hard  
22:02 <lgierth> hey cjd  
22:02 <cjd> howdy  
22:02 <lgierth> this /topic here doesn't have enough colors  
22:03 <cjd> I just work here  
22:03 <lgierth> :(  
22:03 <benedict2> I tried crashey on the pi3 last night, 50 Mbps to my VPS over cjdns  
22:03 <lgierth> on the pi3 -- not bad  
22:03 <cjd> not bad !  
22:04 <benedict2> yup that's 99% cpu utilization on one core  
22:04 <benedict2> same pi also running ipfs  
22:04 <lukevers> has joined #xwiki  
22:04 <benedict2> if the pi is just routing packets for another node, about the same speed (my home internet is 50/50) but only 50% cpu  
22:05 <lgierth> ansuz: heh yeah i can see shoeless joe's door  
22:05 <lgierth> benedict2: yeah no tun0 stuff and kernel/userspace copying  
22:05 <benedict2> cjd: so when there's a release tag I will flip this https://github.com/tomeshnet/prototype-cjdns-pi2/blob/master/scripts/install#L6  
22:05 <ansuz> lgierth: they might have excellent sweet potato fries this time of year  
22:06 <cjd> there is  
22:06 <lgierth> mmmh  
22:06 <cjd> should be pushed  
22:06 <lgierth> let's see how fast the dryer is  
22:06 <benedict2> lgierth: you are near liberty aren't you? shoeless is disgusting  
22:06 <lgierth> my flight to BCN is in 3h  
22:06 <ansuz> or it might be garbage, their service/quality was always hit or miss  
22:06 <lgierth> benedict2: king st. / dufferin  
22:06 <ansuz> benedict2: hit or miss  
22:06 <cjd> benedict2: cjdns-v18 is the most recent tag  
22:06 <benedict2> yup that's the one  
22:06 <ansuz> I've had good food there  
22:06 <ansuz> depends who's working  
22:07 <ansuz> tuesday is probably a bad day  
22:07 <benedict2> cjd: yea but the cpu commits aren't in v18  
22:07 <cjd> they are, there's more after that but those are minor  
22:08 <benedict2> ahh I see, will move to v18 then, it also contains the IPTunnel fixes right?  
22:08 <cjd> yeah  
22:09 <cjd> everything since v18 has been relatively minor  
22:09 <benedict2> cool, also got the resume.service  
22:09 <cjd> and comparitively dangerous -- so you are better off running the release  
22:09 <benedict2> yea I'd only build off of releases  
22:10 <benedict2> did build artifacts move around? the install script wasn't able to find some file when I tried the scripted build and copy  
22:10 <benedict2> but that's easy to sort  
22:11 <cjd> maybe, stuff in /contrib/ does shuffle around from time to time, also tools occasionally  
22:12 <benedict2> it's probably the systemd stuff in contrib  
22:12 <cjd> ahh yeah, I just take PRs to that stuff so I'm not surprised  
22:12 <mflorea> has quit  
22:13 <benedict2> gotta head out, tks for the help with the vpn cjd lgierth  
22:13 <benedict2> byes  
22:13 <cjd> seeya  
22:13 <benedict2> has left #xwiki  
22:13 <lgierth> he's about to fly too  
22:13 <lgierth> maybe we'll meet at the airport  
22:14 <ansuz> you're welcome  
22:14 <cjd> lgierth: https://github.com/cjdelisle/cjdns/blob/master/doc/CjdnsModules.png  
22:15 <cjd> oh whoops  
22:15 <cjd> lgierth: https://github.com/cjdelisle/cjdns/blob/crashey/doc/CjdnsModules.png  
22:15 <lgierth> cjd: what changed  
22:15 <lgierth> ah  
22:16 <lgierth> cjd: so now UpperDistributor distinguishes between data and ctrl packets?  
22:16 <cjd> yup  
22:16 <lgierth> cool cool  
22:17 <cjd> the SessionManager does too because it has to not try to decrypt them  
22:17 <cjd> but this model means we can dump them using the nodejs dumper  
22:17 <lgierth> because they aren't end-to-end encrypted  
22:17 <lgierth> only data packets are  
22:17 <cjd> I have a dumper which spits out CTRL frames into the console in binary, just need to be able to parse them
